config.question: Bill Clinton’s main selling point in his quest for reelection to the presidency in 1996 was __________.

choices.content: that the American military would not be sent to foreign countries
that Republicans were willing to cut social services and welfare programs
a dramatic tax increase was needed to balance the federal deficit
a pledge to diminish the scope of the government and public sector

answer_3.response: Consider This: Following their big wins in the 1994 congressional elections, the Republicans claimed a mandate to resume the Reagan revolution and diminish the scope of government. While the Clinton administration and the Republicans collaborated on welfare reform and a modest increase in the minimum wage, for the most part deadlock descended on Washington. See L.O. 32.3 The New Democrats.
